hackathon-description-text: SpartaHack 2016 is Michigan State University’s second annual student-run hackathon. On the weekend of February 26th, we're bringing together 500 students of all skill levels and disciplines to get creative with tech, connect with peers and professionals, and forget the words "I can't." We're excited to see what you will create!
hackathon-eligibility:
- Participation is limited to high school students, university students, or those who have left school within 2015-2016 school year.
- Minors are accepted!
- Teams can have a maximum of 4 members
- All team members must be registered attendees of SpartaHack
- All members must be physically present at SpartaHack
hackathon-rules:
- Each team is permitted one submission
- Submission must be received by 11:00am on Sunday, February 28th, 2016
- Code submitted for judging must be produced only by team members and written during SpartaHack
- From the start time on Friday, February 26th, 2016 to the end time on Sunday, February 28th, 2016:
By submitting a project, you and your team grant the SpartaHack team the unrestricted right to use your submission material, at no cost, for promotional purposes of future SpartaHack events.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $1,000 shared + $2000 kloudless credit each + 1 Dell Venue each
One year of Wolfram|Alpha Pro each
$400 shared + $500 in Shapeways 3D printing credit shared

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hack to Solve a Business Problem (Blue Medora)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $300 in Cycle credit shared (extra $200 of credit if hack uses Cycle)

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Implementation of Liquid Web's API
Best Java-Based Responsive Web App (Auto-Owners Insurance)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 1 Clarifai skateboard each + 1 DSLR camera each
6 months of blaze credit ($2,694 in Firebase credit) each, 1 Firebase Trophy each, 1 Chromecast each
One year of Wolfram Development Platform, Wolfram Mathematica Student Edition, and Wolfram|Alpha Pro each
1 XK-24 each for winning team, 1 XK-80 for winning individual entry
1 Hubsan X4 Quadcopter with FPV Camera each
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Go Above for those who have Gone Beyond (USAA)
